sources.title: The Secret Four
sources.description: Title: The Secret Four Summary: The Four Men of the title are British WWI veterans who decide to work secretly against enemies of the country. They aren't above a bit of murder or sabotage to serve their ends, but they ... Directed by: Walter Forde Actors: Hugh Sinclair, Griffith Jones, Francis L. Sullivan Production Company: CAPAD Release Date: 21 April 1940 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 The Four Men of the title are British WWI veterans who decide to work secretly against enemies of the country. They aren't above a bit of murder or sabotage to serve their ends, but they consider themselves to be true patriots.

metadata.Plot: The Four Men of the title are British WWI veterans who decide to work secretly against enemies of the country. They aren't above a bit of murder or sabotage to serve their ends, but they consider themselves to be true patriots.
metadata.Writer: Edgar Wallace, Angus MacPhail, Sergei Nolbandov
metadata.Actors: Hugh Sinclair, Griffith Jones, Francis L. Sullivan
